April.title: Smart Mobility Hackathon 2018
April.notes: Form a three-member hacking team, pick a challenge and win valueable prizes or a partnership with one of our industry partners. Our mission is to shape the future of mobility, health and energy of cities in Europe.

April.title: CreatED - Hardware Hackathon
April.notes: CreatED is a 24 hour hardware hackathon being run at the University of Edinburgh. Come along to the only student-run event of its kind for a weekend of free food, making and meeting new people! Open to anyone over the age of 18.

April.title: ShowMeData Hackathon GUS
April.notes: The Statistics Poland organizes a hackathon for students and graduates of IT or related fields. The competition task is to create a prototype of a mobile application with the function of augmented reality, containing elements of e-learning and gamification. The prototype has to make use of public statistical data available in the Eurostat databases (European Statistical Office) by means of API. We expect a user-friendly application with intuitive interface and attractive graphics address at teenagers aged 12-15. We are waiting for teams of 2 to 4 people. All prototypes crated during the hackathon will be evaluated by Jury and the winners will receive valuable prizes for their programs – the main prize is PLN 20,000 (equivalent of USD 5871 or EUR 4768). We speak English, but our hackathon website, registration form (https://rejestracja.stat.gov.pl/hackathon), rules (https://hackathon.stat.gov.pl/regulamin), contract template etc. are available in Polish only. Feel free to translate it (e.g. by Google Translate) and if you have any question please send us e-mail to: hackathon@stat.gov.pl or phone us: +48 22 449 41 45 (Mo-Fr 8:15 to 16:15 CET).

April.title: Hackital Ethereum 2018
April.host: Ames Hall - 2121 I St NW, Washington, DC 20052
April.notes: An Ethereum focused hackathon in the capital, focused on learning and mentorship.
